description: Validate the operation of the accessibility toolbar on the cart page, ensuring options like increasing text size and high contrast mode work as expected.
steps: Locate the accessibility toolbar link with the label 'Open toolbar'.
Click on the 'Open toolbar' link to reveal the accessibility options.
Click on the 'Increase Text' option and verify that the text size on the page increases.
Click on the 'High Contrast' option and validate that the page switches to a high-contrast mode.
Click on the 'Reset Changes' option and confirm that the page reverts to its default appearance.
expected_results: The toolbar options are visible and clickable.
The text size increases after selecting 'Increase Text'.
The high contrast mode is applied after selecting 'High Contrast'.
The default appearance is restored after selecting 'Reset Changes'.
edge_cases: The 'Increase Text' option does not work.
The 'High Contrast' option does not apply changes.
The 'Reset Changes' option fails to restore defaults.
Keyboard navigation does not work for toolbar options.
data_requirements: Accessibility toolbar must be integrated on the cart page.
Options for 'Increase Text', 'High Contrast', and 'Reset Changes' must be functional.
Default styles and text sizes must be defined.
Keyboard and screen-reader support for toolbar elements.
dependencies: Stable CSS and JavaScript for applying visual changes.
api_interactions: None directly related, but monitor for any asynchronous calls triggered by toolbar usage.
performance_metrics: Time taken for changes to be applied.
Impact of accessibility changes on page load performance.
accessibility_requirements: Toolbar must have appropriate ARIA roles.
All options must be accessible via keyboard navigation.
Options must be labeled for screen-readers.
Contrast ratios must meet WCAG standards.
Functional without reliance on mouse interactions.
